skill.name: Frontend Components
skill.description: Design and build reusable, composable UI components following single responsibility principle with clear props, proper encapsulation, and minimal state management. Use this skill when creating or modifying React, Vue, Svelte, or web components, defining component props or interfaces, managing component state, building component libraries, or refactoring UI code. Apply when working with .jsx, .tsx, .vue, .svelte files, component directories, or any code that defines reusable UI building blocks with configurable interfaces and composable architectures.

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no code execution, file access, or network capabilities. It provides guidance on frontend component development patterns and best practices.

content.user_title: Build reusable UI components with best practices
content.value_statement: Frontend development becomes messy without proper component architecture. This skill helps you create clean, reusable UI components that follow industry best practices and maintainable patterns.
actual_capabilities: Creates reusable React, Vue, Svelte, and web components
Implements proper component props and interfaces
Manages component state with minimal complexity
Refactors large components into focused units

use_cases.title: Create component libraries
use_cases.description: Build consistent, reusable UI components for design systems and component libraries across projects.

use_cases.title: Refactor complex UIs
use_cases.description: Break down large, unwieldy components into smaller, focused pieces with clear responsibilities.

use_cases.title: Establish component standards
use_cases.description: Define and implement component architecture patterns that your entire team can follow.

prompt_templates.title: Basic component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a reusable Button component in React with variant prop for primary/secondary styles, disabled state, and onClick handler.

prompt_templates.title: Form component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a form component with input fields, validation logic, and submit handling using controlled components pattern.

prompt_templates.title: List component
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a List component that renders array items with custom item renderer prop, loading state, and empty state handling.

prompt_templates.title: Complex layout
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a dashboard layout component that composes header, sidebar, and content areas with responsive behavior and prop-based configuration.

output_examples.input: Create a reusable Card component for displaying product information
output: Card component with image, title, description, and action button
Configurable props for all content areas

best_practices: Keep components single-purpose and focused on one responsibility
Use clear, descriptive prop names and TypeScript interfaces
Write components with accessibility in mind from the start
anti_patterns: Creating components that do too many things at once
Passing too many props or deeply nested prop drilling
Using state when props would suffice
Building components that are tightly coupled to specific data

faq.question: Which frontend frameworks does this support?
faq.answer: The skill supports React, Vue, Svelte, and vanilla web components with framework-specific best practices.

faq.question: Can it help with component testing?
faq.answer: While focused on component creation, it follows patterns that make components easily testable with proper prop interfaces.

faq.question: Does it handle component styling?
faq.answer: Yes, it helps implement consistent styling approaches including CSS modules, styled-components, and CSS-in-JS solutions.

faq.question: Can it optimize component performance?
faq.answer: The skill implements performance best practices like memoization, proper re-render prevention, and efficient state management.

faq.question: What about accessibility?
faq.answer: All generated components include proper ARIA attributes, keyboard navigation, and screen reader support by default.

faq.question: How does it compare to other component generators?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on architectural patterns and best practices rather than just code generation, ensuring maintainable components.
